meanings.definition: The quality or state of being oncogenic.
meanings.sent1: The oncogenicity of the substance was concerning to the researchers.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the oncogenicity of different chemicals to understand their effects on cells.
meanings.sent3: The oncogenicity of the mutated gene made it the 'bad boy' of the cell world.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had an oncogenicity that spread joy like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The oncogenicity of the virus was like a silent assassin, slowly causing harm.

meanings.sent1: Researchers are investigating the oncogenicity of certain environmental factors.
meanings.sent2: Smoking is known for its oncogenicity and link to lung cancer.
meanings.sent3: The oncogenicity of the sun's rays on fair skin is a reminder to wear sunscreen.
meanings.sent4: The oncogenicity of the toxic waste was like a ticking time bomb in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The oncogenicity of the chemical was like a villain plotting its next move in the body.
